Heidi07 - (01/07/2009 13:41): Hi - is the xwiki eclipse plugin also available via an eclipse update site ?

Heidi07 - (01/07/2009 13:43): yes  
arunreddy - (01/07/2009 13:43): i think its standalone.  
Heidi07 - (01/07/2009 13:47): http://xeclipse.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Installation: "We will soon provide an eclipse update site so that XEclipse can be  installed right from within the IDE itself."

tachirei - (01/07/2009 15:16): any idea about how to add an html file to a patch, using Tortoise SVN? when creating the patch Tortoise inserts a lot of NULL characters instead of the actual HTML content :-|  
tachirei - (01/07/2009 15:24): never mind, it seemed it was a problem with end-of-lines

maggolo joined #xwiki at 16:03  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:10): hi @ all, do you now about the failure if you do an section edit and save the document?  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:11): in XEM 1.7.21212 the page will lose all data and holds just that from the section edit  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:12): maggolo: see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4033  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:12): fixed in XE 1.9.1/XEM 1.7.1  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:14): ok but is not released yet or?  
dignan\_ joined #xwiki at 16:17  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:18): maggolo: no it's not, should be tomorrow  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:18): ok very fine  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:18): thx   
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:18): you can download a SNAPSHOT version in the meantime if you want  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:19): tmortagne: good morning thomas, or is it afternoon for you?  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:19): dignan\_: it's around 4PM here :)  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:19): i see  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:20): so 2.0 is coming along smoothly?  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 16:20  
maggolo - (01/07/2009 16:20): no not enough time till saturday  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:21): dignan\_: we could say that  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:21): :P is something amiss?  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:22): dignan\_: no but there lot of work :)  
kaaloo left at 16:23 (Client Quit)  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:23): true, perhaps some that can be done by volunteers?  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:23): (new volunteers)  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 16:24  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:24): dignan\_: a lot can be done by volunteers, even without dev there is at least translation, 1.0 to 2.0 XE/XEM pages conversion or documentation on xwiki.org  
kaaloo left at 16:25 (Client Quit)  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:25): hmm where can i find information about the translation and page conversions that need to be done?  i did not have any luck building xwiki so i will leave that alone for now :P  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:26): for translation we created a translation management application on l10n.xwiki.org  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:26): let me find the mail about page conversions  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 16:27  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:27): ok  
kaaloo left at 16:28 (Client Quit)  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:28): see http://xwiki.markmail.org/message/xhmjq2ypx6fmwz6q?q=2.0+roadmap+order:date-backward&page=1#query:2.0%20roadmap%20order%3Adate-backward+page:1+mid:joc2wrgyedb4n2ae+state:results  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 16:28  
maggolo left at 16:28 ()  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:29): http://tinyurl.com/mm8k6x  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:29): more friendly URL :)  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:30): yes  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:31): ah, that is good  
jvdrean left at 16:31 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 16:31  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:32): if you can help on this it's great since it's a pretty big work and we have lot's of others stuff also  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 16:35  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:38): yes, i'll do some  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:39): ok thanks  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 16:40): don't hesitate to create jira issue bofore starting to convert a group of pages to make sure there is not several peoples making the same work ;)  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 16:45): ok sounds good ;) thanks  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 16:53  
vmassol left at 17:13 ()  
lucien joined #xwiki at 17:29  
lucien left #xwiki at 17:33  
tachirei left #xwiki at 17:45  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 17:53): tmortagne: do you know a way to float text without html?  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:54): you mean in pure syntax in a wiki page ?  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:55): there is a velocity floating box macro  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:55): #floatingbox("text")  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:55): or   
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:55): #startfloatingbox()  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:56): some text  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:56): #endfloatingbox()  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:56): in xwik/2.0 syntax you can do  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:57): (%class=floatinginfobox%)(((wiki content of the box)))  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:58): or you can set a class to the xwiki/2.0 {{box}} macro  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 17:58): anyway all that generate html at the end but no need to put that in a {{html}} macro in 2.0  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 18:04): yeah  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 18:05): that's what i am trying to avoid is the {{html}} macro, since it seems to me that a wiki should avoid HTML at all costs!  
dignan\_ - (01/07/2009 18:05): lunchtime.  
dignan\_ left at 18:05 ()  
florinciu\_ left at 18:07 ("ChatZilla 0.9.85 [Firefox 3.5/20090624025744]")  
tmortagne - (01/07/2009 18:08): dignan\_: yes that's why we added custom parameters everywhere in the 2.0 syntax to not have anymore to put html just to set a specific class or any other parameter to a table for example
